channel.title: Best Game Soundtracks of All Time
channel.description:
Post your favorite game soundtracks.
Im'a let you all choose, but [url='https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KG8rvcjhlhA']Castlevania: Lords of Shadow[/url] had one of the greatest soundtracks of all time. From start to finish the games and it's soundtrack merged perfectly I can't explain it, you got to experience it for yourself.
Darksiders II Kingdom Hearts(Series) Final Fantasy(Series) Halo(Series) Most of the Mega Man series EVE Online(This is in my top 5 for sure)
I might add more if I can remember.

item.title: Best Game Soundtracks of All Time
item.dc:creator: Bloodshot
item.description:
Was inevitable for me to post this, but I forgot about FEAR’s soundtrack

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DjnhymrZtAY

It really fits the game and not only enhances the atmosphere, but it definitely sounds different enough that I can say this stuff “sounds like FEAR”

Read full topic
item.source: Best Game Soundtracks of All Time

item.title: Best Game Soundtracks of All Time
item.dc:creator: Pyroclase
item.description:
Planetside 2 has some really nice tracks. The neat thing about them is that each of the three playable factions has a completely unique soundtrack; the Vanu get synthy techno music, the Terrans have a suitably heroic, war movie-style soundtrack, and the New Conglomerate get country rock.

VS compilation: https://youtu.be/Cdv13cHWl4U
TR theme song: https://youtu.be/qZtnUCdeW1M
NC compilation: https://youtu.be/zJS_al-QhBw

Read full topic

item.title: Best Game Soundtracks of All Time
item.dc:creator: Fear_Will_Find_You
item.description:
Anybody said Suberbrothers: Sword and Sworcery yet? Awesome soundtrack by Jim Guthrie, probably my favorite game soundtrack.

https://jimguthrie.bandcamp.com/album/sword-sworcery-lp-the-ballad-of-the-space-babies

Other than that, I’d say Portal 2.

Read full topic

item.description:

I actually prefer this version or the midi to most of the heavier remixes

Duke 3d theme remix

I also quite like this version of grabbag, very faithful to the original midi
